subtitle: What a treat for Sunday teatime!

method.text: Preheat oven to 160°C. Lightly grease and line 16 cm x 11cm x 7.5cm rectangular tin
Rinse the cherries under cold running water to remove their stickiness. Drain well. Toss them in the flour to coat well. Cut each in half and set aside.
Cream the butter, sugar and vanilla essence together until pale and creamy. Gradually add a little egg and milk into the mixture, stirring a little flour into the mixture if it begins to curdle.
Stir in the remaining flour, coconut, apricots and cherries until well mixed. Spoon into the tin. Smooth over the surface.
Cook in the oven for 1 hour or until golden brown and risen or until a skewer, when inserted in the centre, comes out clean.
Leave to cool slightly before turning out of tin. Allow to cool completely on a wire rack.
When completely cold, place the sifted icing sugar into a bowl and gradually stir in enough hot water to make into a smooth but pipeable icing.
Spoon into a piping bag fitted with a plain nozzle. Drizzle over the loaf and decorate with the remaining cherries. Serve in slices.

title: Cherry coconut loaf
